alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 29 at 6:09PM EDT until August 29 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hancock County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 608 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Deshler to 6 miles south of Columbus Grove, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. Multiple reports of tree damage have been receieved from this line of storms in Henry and Van Wert Counties. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Findlay, Fostoria, Bluffton, North Baltimore, McComb, Arlington, Arcadia, Rawson, Vanlue, Van Buren, Bloomdale, Mount Blanchard, Benton Ridge, Jenera, Mount Cory, Bairdstown and Williamstown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
